title: Pacers ride bench to Game 3 win over Thunder

content: BJP will fight under Mahayuti; in places where an alliance isn‚Äôt feasible, there may be friendly contests, Maharashtra Chief Minister says

title: India-EU FTA will elevate strategic partnership: Jaishankar

title: Rahul, Stalin wish Lalu on 78th birthday

title: Honeymoon murder: Sonam eyed as mastermind; Raj just pawn; hunt on for hideout
content: Investigators now suspect Sonam Raghuvanshi, involved in the honeymoon murder case, might be the mastermind, manipulating Raj Kushwaha with promises of love. Raj may have unknowingly facilitated her escape, as Sonam allegedly planned a hideout in Indore. She remained there while searches were conducted, later fleeing to Uttar Pradesh when the plan unraveled.

title: Project Pelican: Canada busts major drug racket; ISI-backed Khalistan plot suspected
content: Canadian authorities have dismantled a major narco-terror network, dubbed Project Pelican, with alleged ties to Khalistan sympathizers. The operation seized 479 kg of cocaine, valued at $47.9 million, and arrested nine individuals, including seven of Indian origin. Investigations reveal the network used commercial trucking routes from the US, linked to Mexican cartels, to traffic drugs.

title: Trump unveils US 'Gold Card' website: Who can apply, eligibility
content: Donald Trump's "Gold Card," offering a path to US citizenship for foreigners investing $5 million, has launched its waiting list. Trump announced the opening via social media, highlighting the immense interest.

title: IND vs ENG: Gambhir discloses how India can have a 'memorable tour'; Gill shares approach
content: Gautam Gambhir, the Indian cricket team's head coach, motivated the squad, including new captain Shubman Gill and debutants, during a pre-series nets session in Beckenham. He emphasised seizing the opportunity to create a memorable tour despite the absence of experienced players - Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma and R Ashwin.

title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang: There‚Äôs a new programming language. It is called‚Ä¶
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang recently highlighted AI's transformative potential, stating it democratizes programming by enabling users to instruct computers using natural language. He likened programming AI to guiding a person, emphasizing the ease with which AI can now perform complex tasks like writing poems.

title: Jealousy, rivalry over love triangle: Man strangled, body found stuffed in fridge; doctor held
content: In Tripura, a shocking murder case has unfolded with the arrest of six individuals, including a doctor and his parents. Sariful Islam, an electrician, was allegedly murdered in Agartala due to a love triangle involving Dr. Dibakar Saha and a woman.

title: 'They can't have nukes': Why US is pulling troops from parts of Middle East
content: Amid rising tensions and stalled nuclear negotiations, the US is reducing its diplomatic and military presence in the Middle East. The State Department ordered nonessential staff to depart from Baghdad and authorized optional departures from Bahrain and Kuwait. The military is also allowing voluntary departures of dependents as regional instability looms and the IAEA considers censuring Iran.

title: Space menu includes grilled chicken & more; thanks to Indian-origin scientist
content: Indian-origin food scientist Professor Suresh Pillai is revolutionising space cuisine, ensuring astronauts enjoy nutritious and culturally relevant meals. As Shubhanshu Shukla prepares to be the first Indian astronaut on the ISS with Axiom Mission 4, Pillai's work takes center stage. His lab's eBeam technology sterilises food without heat, crucial for long-duration missions. NASA's meticulously crafted Indian-style barramundi fish curry exemplifies this innovation. Shukla will savor home-style Indian dishes alongside standard NASA fare, enhancing well-being in microgravity.

title: New temperature rule for ACs: Why cooling will be limited between 20¬∞C & 28¬∞C
content: The Indian government is planning to implement a new rule standardizing air conditioner temperatures between 20¬∞C and 28¬∞C to curb excessive electricity consumption. This initiative aims to manage India's rising energy demand, particularly during peak summer months when AC usage significantly strains the power supply.

title: Deportation case: Federal judge orders release of Palestinian activist Mahmoud Khalil
content: A federal judge ordered the release of Mahmoud Khalil, a legal US resident detained after participating in pro-Palestinian demonstrations. The judge cited irreparable harm to Khalil's career and free speech rights due to his detention. Despite the ruling, Khalil will remain in custody pending a possible government appeal, highlighting ongoing legal battles over activism and immigration.

title: Indian-origin man jailed in US; duped senior citizens as 'money mule'
content: Pranav Patel, an Indian-origin man, received a six-year prison sentence for his role in a fraud targeting senior citizens. He laundered $1,791,301, collected from elderly victims across the eastern US, who were deceived by overseas callers posing as US treasury officials. One victim even lost his home due to the scam.

title: New dinosaur species 'Dragon Prince' discovered ‚Äî what did it look like?
content: Khankhuuluu mongoliensis, or "Dragon Prince," a newly identified tyrannosauroid species, roamed Mongolia 86 million years ago. Initially misidentified, high-tech scans revealed this agile predator, weighing 750 kilos, predates T. rex. This discovery suggests tyrannosaurs possibly originated in Asia, migrated to North America, and then returned, reshaping our understanding of dinosaur evolution and distribution.

title: Buying iPhone in Dubai vs in India: Pros &cons; cost savings yes, but ...
content: For Indian Apple enthusiasts, purchasing the iPhone 16 in Dubai presents a mixed bag. While Pro models offer potential cost savings, non-Pro versions might be pricier. Buying in Dubai means missing out on Indian bank offers and exchange discounts. FaceTime restrictions and potential import duties also need consideration, impacting the overall value proposition.

title: Kennedy Center: Donald Trump and Melania cheered, booed; watch video
content: President Trump's attendance at the Kennedy Center's 'Les Mis√©rables' opening was met with mixed reactions amidst his efforts to reshape the institution. Accompanied by Melania Trump and GOP allies, his visit coincided with reports of cast boycotts and followed his controversial overhaul of the center's leadership and proposed arts funding cuts.

title: 'Take it or leave it': Trump may extend July 8 tariff deadline
content: Donald Trump indicated flexibility on extending the trade talk deadline. However, he believes it might not be essential. Discussions are ongoing with multiple countries. The US will soon send letters outlining final trade deal terms. A deal with China is reportedly done, pending final approval pending final approval from Trump  and Chinese President Xi Jinping

title: 'I think he became a better cricketer': Sanjana Ganesan on Jasprit Bumrah
content: Sanjana Ganesan revealed that Jasprit Bumrah's cricket has improved since their son Angad's birth, attributing it to a peaceful home life. She also highlighted the unique personalities of cricketers' wives and their complementary roles. Sanjana shared lighthearted moments with Bumrah, noting his attempts to distract her during interviews and their comfortable off-field bond as 'gossip buddies'.

title: 'Within 45 metres': Chinese fighter jets fly close to Japan military aircraft
content: Tokyo has lodged a strong protest with Beijing following a dangerous encounter between Chinese fighter jets and a Japanese patrol plane in the Pacific. The incident, occurring last weekend, involved Chinese jets flying within 45 meters of the Japanese aircraft.

title: 'We know where we want to get to'- Brendon McCullum confident in England‚Äôs new bowling unit
content: England's head coach Brendon McCullum expressed excitement about the upcoming five-Test series against India, highlighting the team's varied bowling attack. Despite missing key bowlers, he praised the emerging talent, including spinner Shoaib Bashir. India, embarking on a new era without veterans like Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli, will begin their WTC cycle. Shubman Gill will be leading the side.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens flat; BSE Sensex above 82,500
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened flat in trade on Thursday, While Nifty50 opened above 25,150, BSE Sensex was above 82,500.

title: Who is Zeeshan Akhtar? Key conspirator in Baba Siddique murder held in Canada; linked to Bishnoi gang
content: Zeeshan Akhtar, accused of involvement in the murder of NCP politician Baba Siddique, has been detained in Canada based on an Interpol notice. Mumbai police are awaiting official confirmation. Akhtar, a 22-year-old from Punjab, is alleged to have been a key conspirator, managing finances and coordinating with other accused linked to the Lawrence and Anmol Bishnoi gang.

title: Maharashtra FYJC general merit list released: Direct download link- what to do next
content: The Maharashtra School Education and Sports Department has released the final general merit list for FYJC Class 11 admissions 2025 on mahafyjcadmissions.in. Following a revised timeline to accommodate grievance redressals, the list marks the beginning of zero-round admissions. Over 20 lakh seats across 9,281 colleges are on offer for Arts, Science, and Commerce streams.

title: Fact-check: Can fruit seeds pose a threat to the appendix?
content: The belief that fruit seeds cause appendicitis is largely a myth. Studies show seeds rarely contribute to the condition. Appendicitis is usually due to blockages or infections. Research indicates foreign objects can affect the appendix. Appendicitis and appendix cancer are distinct. Appendicitis is inflammation, not cancer. Sometimes, appendicitis surgery reveals hidden tumors.

title: WTC Final: History made after 145 years at Lord‚Äôs
content: Kagiso Rabada's stunning five-wicket haul helped South Africa dismiss Australia for 212 on Day 1 of the WTC Final at Lord's. However, Australia fought back, leaving South Africa at 43 for 4 at stumps. The day also saw a historic first, with both teams' No. 1 batters dismissed for a duck.

title: I'm still trying to fathom how I've done that' Steve Smith on his dismissal
content: Steve Smith achieved a milestone at Lord's, surpassing batting records. He scored 66 runs during the World Test Championship final. Australia was struggling initially, but Smith's innings stabilized the team. Kagiso Rabada took five wickets, becoming South Africa's leading bowler at Lord's. Both Smith and Rabada shared insights on the pitch conditions.

title: Faridabad family suicide horror: Parathas to plans for outing, calm before tragedy
content: In Faridabad, Manoj Mehto took his four sons to railway tracks. He bought them chips and cola. Then, he held them firmly as the Golden Temple Express approached. The train ran them over, killing them all. Police are investigating the motive. Preeti, Manoj's wife, is left alone. Neighbors are shocked and offer condolences.

title: Buy or sell: Stock recommendations for today - check list
content: Top stock market recommendations: Nuvama Professional Clients Group's Aakash K Hindocha recommends Tata Motors, Mphasis, and Hero Motocorp as top stock picks. Nifty is expected to reach 25400/25600, while Bank Nifty aims for 57200/57600.

title: In kharif season, water levels at 2 key Pakistan dams near ‚Äòdead levels'
content: Pakistan faces a growing water crisis as reduced flows from Indian rivers, particularly the Indus, Jhelum, and Chenab, lead to greater discharge than inflow. This situation, exacerbated by India's dam desilting, threatens key agricultural provinces like Punjab and Sindh. With monsoon rains still weeks away and the Indus Water Treaty suspended, Pakistan anticipates significant water shortages for farming.

title: WTC Final: Mitchell Starc surpasses Mohammed Shami during Aus vs SA
content: Mitchell Starc etched his name in history at Lord's, becoming the leading wicket-taker in ICC tournament finals with 11 wickets, surpassing Mohammed Shami. Australia's pace attack, led by Starc, dismantled South Africa, leaving them reeling at 43 for 4 after being bowled out for 212. Kagiso Rabada's five-wicket haul and a rare statistical anomaly marked a day dominated by bowlers.

title: Census 2027 goes digital; data in 9 months; mobile app to replace paper forms
content: India's Census 2027 aims for a swift data release by late 2027, leveraging digital technology for the first time. Enumerators will use mobile apps in 16 languages, offering citizens a self-enumeration option. This tech-driven approach, including pre-coded responses and intelligent character recognition, promises to significantly reduce processing time compared to previous censuses, with a dedicated portal for management and monitoring.

title: Full India-US trade pact may take time; govt awaits clarity on Trump‚Äôs policy
content: India and the US are aiming to finalize an initial trade deal by July 9, but a comprehensive agreement may take longer due to the Trump administration's evolving trade policies. Key issues include tariff implementation, competitiveness for Indian exporters, and protecting sensitive sectors like agriculture.

title: Elon Musk called Trump before posting regret over online feud
content: Elon Musk reached out to Donald Trump, expressing regret for his critical social media posts after a phone call between the two. This reconciliation attempt follows a public feud sparked by policy disagreements and personal attacks, with Trump previously dismissing any reconciliation.

title: ‚ÄòThug Life‚Äô day 7: Film earns Rs 1.25cr; crosses Rs 42cr milestone in 1st week
content: Kamal Haasan and Mani Ratnam's 'Thug Life,' reuniting them after 37 years, faces a box office slowdown after a strong opening on June 5, 2025. The gangster drama, starring Silambarasan TR and Trisha Krishnan, earned Rs 15.5 crore on its first day but dipped to Rs 1.25 crore by Day 7, bringing the total to Rs 42.25 crore.

title: Harvard study says Vitamin D may actually slow down aging
content: A recent study suggests that daily vitamin D supplements may slow down biological aging at the cellular level. Researchers found that vitamin D intake significantly reduced telomere shortening, the protective caps on chromosomes that wear down with age. This effect equated to nearly three years of slower cellular aging compared to a placebo.

title: Does India trust Trump? EAM says nat‚Äôl interest is the pivot, not personalities
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar emphasized India's commitment to strengthening ties with the US, irrespective of political leadership, citing it as crucial for India's interests. He cautioned Europe about the potential repercussions of ignoring terrorism, referencing Osama bin Laden's presence in Pakistan.

title: 'Housefull 5' closes in on Rs 120 crore; earns Rs 8 crore on Wednesday at box office
content: Akshay Kumar is back with 'Housefull 5'. The film is doing well at the box office. It has already earned over Rs 100 crore. The movie stars Akshay Kumar, Abhishek Bachchan, and Riteish Deshmukh. 'Housefull 5' faced competition from 'Thug Life'. The film presents a new mystery plot on a cruise ship. There are two different endings available for viewers.

title: Social security cover up from 24% in 2019 to 64%: ILO report
content: India's social protection coverage has significantly expanded, reaching 64.3% of the population and covering approximately 94 crore citizens, according to the ILO. The government is actively registering gig workers to provide them with targeted benefits. However, India still faces challenges with child labor, with over 10 million children estimated to be in labor.

title: Is Angelina Jolie and Brad Pitt's daughter engaged to actor Elijah Cooper? what we know
content: Zahara Jolie-Pitt, daughter of Angelina Jolie and Brad Pitt, ignited engagement rumors after being photographed with a diamond ring while leaving Craig's restaurant with actor Elijah Cooper. The 20-year-old's ring sparked speculation, amplified by Cooper following Zahara's private Instagram account. While neither Zahara nor her family have commented, Cooper's background as an actor, Morehouse College student, and streetwear company co-founder adds intrigue to the unfolding story.

title: ‚ÄòCannot have nuclear weapons‚Äô:Trump vows to stop Iran; US orders Iraq embassy exit
content: Amid rising tensions and a partial US embassy evacuation in Iraq, Donald Trump has firmly stated that the United States will prevent Iran from acquiring nuclear weapons. Diplomatic efforts to revive the nuclear deal face hurdles, particularly regarding uranium enrichment.

title: Wife kills hubby 18 yrs after marriage,dumps body in river with lover‚Äôs help
content: In Siddharthnagar, Sangeeta Devi and her lover, Anil Shukla, were arrested for murdering Sangeeta's husband, Kannan Kumar. Sangeeta poisoned Kannan after a temple visit and, with Anil, threw his body into the Rapti river. She then filed a missing person report, but inconsistencies led to her confession. Kannan's brother had already suspected foul play due to marital issues.

title: Indian detained at Newark had no visa, wasn‚Äôt fit to travel: Govt
content: The Indian government confirmed that an Indian national detained at Newark Airport entered the U.S. illegally without a valid visa and was being deported following a court order. Authorities restrained him due to disruptive behavior during transit and admitted him to a medical facility. The Indian Consulate in New York is engaged with U.S.

title: SC: Homebuyer seeking refund can't ask builder to reimburse loan interest
content: The Supreme Court has ruled that homebuyers seeking refunds for project delays are not entitled to reimbursement for home loan interest paid. The court clarified that developers are only obligated to refund the principal amount and compensate with interest as per the agreement.

title: Diplomatic setback? Cong targets PM over US gen's Pak praise
content: The Congress party has intensified its criticism of Prime Minister Modi, demanding answers on post-Pahalgam security challenges and foreign policy. They questioned Modi regarding a US General's praise of Pakistan as a counter-terrorism partner, calling it a diplomatic setback for India which had sent delegations to expose Pakistan's stand on terror.

title: Post Pahalgam attack, anti-terror squad deployed for 1st time at Valley of Flowers
content: Uttarakhand Police has deployed an anti-terror squad at Ghangaria, near the Valley of Flowers and Hemkund Sahib, following the Pahalgam terror attack. This unprecedented security measure aims to safeguard tourists and pilgrims visiting the popular Himalayan sites.

title: RTIs filed over samosas & grooms, Bombay HC irked by misuse
content: The Bombay High Court has criticized the misuse of the Right to Information (RTI) Act, citing frivolous applications like one seeking the number of samosas served daily in a government office. Hearing a PIL regarding delays in disposing of second appeals, the court noted the Act's beneficial purpose is being undermined.

title: Telangana phone-tapping: SIB ex-chief admits to political surveillance
content: Former SIB chief T Prabhakar Rao admitted to political surveillance by a special operations team during his tenure, claiming senior police officials were aware. He stated the SOT, formed in 2018, exceeded its anti-Naxal mandate, operating under DSP G Praneeth Rao.

title: Delhi Records Highest Peak Power Demand Of This Summer On June 11
content: Amid soaring temperatures, Delhi recorded its highest peak power demand of this summer on June 11. The real-time figures of the State Load Dispatch Centre (SLDC) showed the peak demand was 8,231 MW at 10.55 pm.

title: 'Flying Buses' For Bengaluru's Traffic Chaos? What Nitin Gadkari Told NDTV
content: India is evaluating new modes of futuristic transport, including elevated airpod-based systems and flash-charging electric buses, to tackle traffic congestion and reduce pollution in metro cities, Nitin Gadkari told NDTV.

title: "Can't Just Walk Away": Bangladesh's Yunus' Sheikh Hasina Chat With PM Modi
content: Bangladesh's interim leader, Nobel Peace laureate Muhammad Yunus, issued a rebuke of former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina's public statements from Indian soil, claiming that he personally urged Prime Minister Narendra Modi to intervene.

title: Probe Agency ED Raids In Rajasthan, Gujarat In Rs 2,700 Crore Fraud Case
content: The Enforcement Directorate on Thursday conducted searches in Rajasthan and Gujarat as part of a money laundering investigation into an alleged Rs 2,700 crore fraud with investors, official sources said.

title: Trump Said He "Could" Forgive Musk In An Interview, Before X Boss Apologised
content: US President Donald Trump said in an interview recorded on Monday, for podcast Pod Force One, that he "could" fix the relationship with billionaire Elon Musk.

title: Indore Man Kills Grandmother, 65, For Money, Hides Body In Bed: Cops
content: A 28 year old man in Indore allegedly strangled his 65-year-old grandmother who later hid her body in a bed storage box. He has been arrested within hours of the crime after he attempted to flee to Rajasthan.

title: 5 Injured After Mob Clashes With Cops Near Kolkata, BJP Seeks Central Forces
content: Tension simmered in the Rabindranagar area near Kolkata on Wednesday as a violent clash between two groups spiralled into widespread unrest, leaving several police personnel injured and multiple vehicles vandalised.

title: US On High Alert Amid Fear Of Israeli Strike On Iran's Nuclear Sites: Report
content: The United States is reportedly on high alert amid rising fears of a potential Israeli strike on Iran.

title: A Burger You Purchase On Swiggy, Zomato Is Cheaper On Rapido. Here's Why
content: AMcChicken burger, fries and a drink. This meal from this restaurant is available in three different prices, depending on whether you order from Swiggy, Zomato, or Rapido.

title: Broken, Dirty Seats: BSF Soldiers Get 'Filthy' Train Coaches, 4 Suspended
content: Four railway officials have been suspended after a dilapidated train was allotted to carry Border Security Force personnel to Jammu and Kashmir for security duty during the Amarnath Yatra.

title: "Sonam Wanted Raja To Visit Kamakhya Temple Because...": What Police Said
content: Raja Raghuvanshi, the Indore resident killed while honeymooning in Meghalaya, was told by his wife Sonam that she would let him consummate the marriage only after making an offering at the Kamakhya Temple in Guwahati, investigators said on Wednesday.

title: Video: Solar Orbiter Spacecraft Reveals Sun's South Pole For The First Time
content: The robotic Solar Orbiter spacecraft has obtained the first images ever taken of our sun's two poles as scientists seek a deeper understanding of Earth's host star, including its magnetic field, its 11-year cycle of activity and the solar wind.

title: Trump Launches "Gold Card" Website. How To Signup For $5 Million Wishlist
content: US President Donald Trump on Wednesday launched a website for immigrants to register their interest in signing up for the long-touted "gold card," which would offer successful foreigners a path to US citizenship after paying $5 million to government.

title: "If I Was Quiet...": Raja Raghuvanshi's Sister On Backlash Over Reels
content: The massive backlash online began when Srashti, who has 4,81,000 followers on Instagram, posted a video lashing out at Sonam - with the couple's marriage picture and a video as the backdrop.

title: 'Love Triangle Murder' In Tripura, Body Of Missing Man Found In Ice-Cream Freezer
content: The mystery behind the disappearance of a youth from Agartala's Indranagar area was solved on Wednesday, with his body being discovered from inside a trolley bag hidden in an ice-cream freezer.

title: Red Alert In Delhi As Heat Index Hits 51.9 Degrees, Relief Likely After June 13
content: A red alert was issued for Delhi as it remained in the grip of an intense heatwave, with temperatures ranging from 40.9 to 45.0 degrees Celsius across various weather stations on Wednesday.

title: "Dangerous Place": Trump Says US To Pull Some Troops From Middle East Amid Iran Tensions
content: US President Donald Trump said on Wednesday US personnel were being moved out of the Middle East because "it could be a dangerous place," adding that the United States would not allow Iran to have a nuclear weapon.

title: Amid Unrest, Trump Sends More US Troops To LA Than In Iraq, Syria Combined
content: US President Donald Trump has reportedly sent more American troops to the city of Los Angeles (LA) in California-- to curb the protests against his harsh immigration policies -- than those deployed in Iraq and Syria by Washington.

title: Donald Trump "Acknowledged" Elon Musk's Apology, Says White House
content: White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt on Wednesday (local time) said that US President Donald Trump acknowledged Tesla CEO Elon Musk's apology for his comments.

title: Operating Multipolar World Is More Like Chess Game: S Jaishankar
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar, while speaking at GMF Brussels Forum 2025, explained his comment on Europe that he made in 2022, saying that in these three years, Europe's stance has evolved.

title: The field of 8 is set: NCAA baseball tournament schedule, results
content: the field for the men's college world series in Omaha, Nebraska, is set . it'll be the Racers' first time in Omaha . four teams are making their first appearances in Omaha since winning the title the last time they made it this far .

title: Where Indiana lands among the NBA's most surprising Finals runs
content: the Indiana Pacers host Game 3 of the NBA Finals on friday (8:30 p.m. ET, ABC) it will be the first Finals game in a quarter century . the Pacers needed to knock off a 64-win Cleveland Cavaliers in Round 2, then win a second series .

title: Adams: U.S. tunes out Donovan, Dempsey 'noise'
content: Mauricio Pochettino and Clint Dempsey are among those criticizing the men's national team . the pair share the american goals record with 57 goals each . "we don't talk about that internally as a group," Adams said during a Zoom interview .

title: What to know ahead of the Canadian Grand Prix
content: Max Verstappen could be under pressure this weekend at the Canadian grand prix . he is just one penalty point from a race ban following the incident with George Russell in Spain . the forecast for the 44th race at Montreal is set to be cloudy on Friday .

title: Chisholm hurt, Nola's potential return delayed
content: the fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around MLB . seven more matinees follow with the remaining seven tilts played under the lights . new york Yankees 3B jazz Chisholm Jr . left last night's game in the seventh inning due to a tight neck .

title: Divisional: New women's bantamweight champion takes the top spot
content: Kayla Harrison becomes the new women's bantamweight champion . she finished Julianna Pea with a beautiful second-round Kimura . pea falls to no. 2 in the men's championship rematch .

title: 16 players to trade for or trade away in dynasty leagues
content: running backs tend to have shorter careers because of the physical demands of the position . since 2010, there have been 105 seasons with 250 or more fantasy points . of those, 98 seasons came from RBs between the ages of 21 and 28 .

title: EA Sports FC 25 Title Update No. 15 improves ground passes
content: the latest Title Update for EA Sports FC 25 has arrived . players with high Passing attributes have received an accuracy increase on their ground passes . this is supposed to close the gap to athletes with passing-related PlayStyles . the developer wants both types of players to be viable .

title: College football's top 25 plays since 2000
content: a college football game guarantees you certain things, you will get tailgate smells . the top 25 plays of the 2000s are voted on by ESPN college football writers . some decided national titles, some provided all-time rivalry bragging rights .

title: NBA Finals: Biggest takeaways from Pacers' first home win over Thunder
content: Oklahoma City Thunder vs. Indiana Pacers: Game Highlights (2:18) a longtime scout texted one sentence: "this is the first game that's felt like a Finals game" the series arrived in the Hoosier State tied at a game apiece . the Pacers had led for 94 of the first 96 minutes of the series .

title: Tigers' Jobe needs season-ending elbow surgery
content: rookie pitcher Jackson Jobe will undergo season-ending surgery on his right elbow . jobe was 4-1 with a 4.22 ERA in 10 starts this year . the right-hander felt discomfort in the elbow during a start against the visiting San Francisco Giants .

title: Oakmont is going to be the main character at the 2025 U.S. Open
content: oakmont Country Club has hosted 10 U.S. Opens now -- the most of any course in the country . the clubhouse is dotted with quaint homes . it's a barrier between the idyllic neighborhood and one of golf's most terrifying tests .

title: Future Power Rankings: How all 68 Power 4 college football teams stack up
content: college football 's future power rankings have been reimagined as part of a changing sport . the rankings will examine the next two seasons -- in this case, the 2025 and 2026 seasons -- and function more as a snapshot of the landscape . a spring portal changes things, and QB rooms can look moderately or significantly different by late May or early June .
